radiographic_examinations.findings: Inflammatory fat stranding around the cecum centered around a hyperdense diverticula. A normal appendix is seen. No focal fluid collection in this area, or intraperitoneal free fluid or air. The remainder of the colon is normal without further diverticula noted. Lung bases are clear. The liver, spleen, pancreas, gallbladder, kidneys, and adrenals appear normal. The distal esophagus, stomach, and duodenum are unremarkable. Small bowel and its mesentery are normal. Bone evaluation is grossly unremarkable without concerning lytic or blastic osseous lesions.
